item.title: Linear Regression, Part 1 - Cost Functions
item.description: The objective of regression is to fit a line through a given data set. Hence, if we are given a set of points; $$ (x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), \dots, (x_i, y_i), \dots ,(x_n, y_n)$$ we want to fit the line $\hat{y} = a_0 + a_1 x$ through the given set of data. The equation $ a_0 + a_1 x$ is known as the hypothesis function. It would be trivial if a line could exactly represent the data provided.
